title: Wife of Trump's ex-campaign manager said he made suicidal comments, police report says
description: The wife of President Donald Trump's former campaign manager, Brad Parscale, told police that her husband had made "suicidal comments throughout the week" before he was detained and hospitalized Sunday.

title: Lone officer charged in connection to Breonna Taylor's killing pleads not guilty
description: The sole Louisville police officer charged in connection to Breonna Taylor's killing will make his first court appearance Monday afternoon and is expected to plead not guilty.

title: 'Everything he says is false': CDC chief concerned about Trump's Covid adviser
Watch what happened when CNN reporter went to Proud Boys rally
description: CNN's Elle Reeve spent time with the Proud Boys, a far-right group, during a rally in Portland, Oregon. Hear what they have to say about their beliefs and reputation of being violent.

title: Famed winery destroyed by wildfire
description: The famed 41-year-old Chateau Boswell Winery in Napa Valley, California, was destroyed during the Glass Fire on Sunday evening, according to CNN affiliate KPIX.

title: Sweden may have tackled Covid. But its strategy may be dangerous to follow.
description: An expert on the spread of Covid-19 proclaimed last week that the pandemic in Sweden was essentially over — the virus there was "running out of steam," he said, as researchers suggest Swedes could be building immunity.

title: Don't miss the Ivanka Trump bombshell buried in tax story
description: The big bombshell in The New York Times tax returns story is, obviously, the fact that President Donald Trump paid just $750 in federal income taxes in each 2016 and 2017 -- and for 10 of the 15 previous years, paid no federal income taxes at all.

title: 9 key takeaways from the bombshell Trump tax report
9 key takeaways from the bombshell Trump tax report
description:
• Analysis: Trump's tax returns reveal why he really ran for president
• Opinion: Trump's taxes tell tale of desperation

title: Romanian village reelects dead mayor, saying he deserved to win
description: Romanian villagers have re-elected their mayor by a landslide even though he died two weeks ago from Covid-19 complications, saying he had done a good job and deserved his posthumous victory.

title: See tornado move up popular US beach
description: An EF-0 tornado with 75-mph winds sent beachgoers scrambling in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina.

title: This is what Trump said about Obama paying taxes
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar reviews past tweets sent by Donald Trump accusing then President Barack Obama of not paying enough income tax and blasting Americans for not paying enough taxes.

title: 'Everything he says is false': CDC chief reportedly concerned about Trump's Covid adviser
description: US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Director Dr. Robert Redfield is concerned that White House Coronavirus Task Force member Dr. Scott Atlas is providing President Trump with misleading information about Covid-19, a federal official told CNN.

title: CNN's Poppy Harlow shuts down White House official: Stop attacking the press
description: CNN's Poppy Harlow presses White House Deputy Press Secretary Brian Morgenstern about the bombshell New York Times' report on President Trump's taxes.

title: Pandemic draining resources from Syrian camp
description: CNN's Jomana Karadsheh takes a rare look inside Syria's Al-Hol camp and the conditions of the women and children living there.

title: Trump's attempts to discredit Biden could come back to haunt him in first debate
Fred Perry stops selling polo shirt associated with the 'Proud Boys'
description: British apparel-maker Fred Perry has pulled a polo shirt from the US market after it became associated with the far-right group the Proud Boys.

title: The 10 Senate seats most likely to flip 5 weeks from Election Day
description: President Donald Trump's nomination of Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court over the weekend is likely to further nationalize the fight for control of the Senate, with Republicans looking to defend a majority that was very much at stake well before Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg died.

title: Puppet models, aquatic escapism and the tentative return of runways at Milan Fashion Week
description: Milan Fashion Week (MFW) came to an optimistic close Sunday, having hosted significantly more in-person runway shows than either London or New York before it.

title: Man says face and full-body tattoos cost him his kindergarten teaching job
description: A schoolteacher whose body, face and tongue are covered in tattoos and who has had the whites of his eyes surgically turned black said he was prevented from teaching at a French kindergarten after a parent complained he scared their child.

title: Rose Leslie and Kit Harington are expecting their first child
description: Winter is coming, but so is parenthood

title: Armenia and Azerbaijan are clashing over a disputed region. Here's what you need to know
description: The dispute over Nagorno-Karabakh has run hot and cold since the 1994 ceasefire -- one of several "frozen conflicts" that blight the post-Soviet world. Yet this weekend's clashes mark a new height in rhetoric and signs of intent.

title: Chrissy Teigen hospitalized after suffering bleeding during latest pregnancy
description: Chrissy Teigen has been hospitalized in Los Angeles after suffering heavy bleeding during her pregnancy.

title: Taylor Swift tops Whitney Houston's record for most weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 chart
description: Taylor Swift has surpassed Whitney Houston for the most weeks at No. 1 by a woman on the Billboard 200 album chart.

title: 1 in 3 parents won't get flu shots for their child during Covid-19, study finds
description: One-third of American parents have no plans to get their children vaccinated for the flu this year, according to the National Poll on Children's Health released Monday, despite the very real possibility their child could also catch the deadly Covid-19.

title: Caesars could buy William Hill for $3.7 billion as sports betting booms
description: Caesars Entertainment is in talks to buy William Hill in a deal that would value the British bookmaker at £2.9 billion ($3.7 billion) and underscore the size of the opportunity in online gaming and sports betting in the United States.

title: Bayern Munich suffers first defeat of 2020; Lionel Messi back on the scoresheet for Barcelona
description: Bayern Munich had swept aside everything before it during 2020 -- until Sunday.

title: CNN asks Jill Biden: Is Joe ready to debate Trump?
description: CNN's Jake Tapper sits down with Jill Biden in an exclusive interview ahead of the first presidential debate between former Vice President Joe Biden and President Donald Trump.

title: Indigenous sites at risk of government-approved coal mining
description: Despite the backlash over the destruction of a 46,000-year-old sacred indigenous site by mining giant Rio Tinto, thousands of similar sites in Australia remain at risk from mining, the country's biggest industry. Journalist Angus Watson reports.

title: Why Mexico City is struggling to enforce hand washing
description: One of the main ways to fight Covid-19 is washing hands. But for many families in one of Mexico City's poorest neighborhoods, this is not an option due to the lack of clean water. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

title: China's Xi says Xinjiang policies 'completely correct'
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping believes his policies in the far-western region of Xinjiang are "completely correct," despite growing international criticism of alleged human rights abuses and mass internment.

title: Clashes break out between Armenia and Azerbaijan over disputed region
description: Long-simmering tensions between Armenia and Azerbaijan appear to have flared up in the contested Nagorno-Karabakh region, with both sides accusing each other of attacking civilians.

title: Former Trump campaign manager hospitalized following reported suicide attempt
description: President Donald Trump's former campaign manager Brad Parscale was hospitalized Sunday following reports of a suicide attempt at his Florida home, CNN has learned.

title: Napa County brush fire rapidly grows, forcing hospital to evacuate
description: A fire that began overnight in Napa County, California, has rapidly burned 1,200 acres, forcing a local hospital to evacuate on Sunday while authorities placed 5,000 people under evacuation notices.

title: BTS will release new album in November
description: Two albums in one year? That's how Korean pop group BTS is blessing fans in 2020.

title: Judge rules TikTok can avoid a ban in the US, for now
description: TikTok won't be kicked off of US app stores — at least not yet.

title: Van Jones: This isn't Donald Trump shenanigans as usual
description: CNN commentators Rick Santorum and Van Jones react a New York Times report stating that President Donald Trump paid no federal income taxes whatsoever in 10 out of 15 years beginning in 2000 because he reported losing significantly more than he made.

title: Philippines dream journey: Exploring Palawan's stunning islands on a traditional fishing boat
description: Palawan has been called the "best island in the world" and the Philippines' "last biodiversity frontier."

title: Xi Jinping reinforces China's position as a global superpower
New York Times: Trump paid no income taxes in 10 out of 15 years beginning in 2000
description: Donald Trump paid no federal income taxes whatsoever in 10 out of 15 years beginning in 2000 because he reported losing significantly more than he made, according to an explosive report released Sunday by the New York Times.

title: Jill Biden reacts to Trump attacks
description: Jill Biden, the wife of Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, said her husband is "ready" to face Donald Trump in the first presidential debate this week and accused the President of trying to distract with smears during the tense campaign.

title: Trump team using $300M in taxpayer dollars to make us feel better about Covid-19
description: Over the past two weeks, an alarming 24% rise in the number of new Covid-19 cases confirmed on a daily basis in the United States has raised the daily infection average to nearly 43,000. Twice last week the US broke 50,000 new cases confirmed in a day. While that's below the daily average of 65,000 in July's deadly spike, it's still well above the 35,000 daily new cases seen just a few weeks ago.

title: Man sentenced to year in jail for holding large parties, violating Covid-19 rules
description: A Maryland man was sentenced to a year in jail for holding two large parties and violating the state's order against large gatherings, according to the Charles County state's attorney's office.
